website_summaries.verdict: This steam iron was built with convenience in mind and generates even heat and steam every time.
pros: Automatically adjusts steam output depending on temperature
Produces a strong, even burst of steam
cons: Water reservoir can be difficult to open and fill

customer_reviews.title: I needed something better that would do a good job in lesser time
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my cheap lightweight 6 year old iron. While the previous iron still worked, I needed something better that would do a good job in lesser time. This iron is heavy enough to do a good job, holds enough water and releases a good amount of steam. I like the self cleaning mechanism. Steel plates seem to be better and longer lasting than the non tick soleplate I had in my previous iron. For the price, its definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: V. Kapoor

customer_reviews.title: Great overall! Just needs a couple tweaks or updates.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this iron. There are a couple of issues I noticed, and could could use improvements: First, is the view window for the water level, the whole tank is a burgundy, which makes seeing the water level difficult, if there was a clear strip on either (or both sides), to easily identify the water line, that would be uber beneficial; Second, the warming light doesn't seem to turn off, but the iron is adequately hot for the given setting(s). When I first used the iron it did go off at the desired temperature, but has since stopped turning off, not sure if this is a short, or other defect of sorts.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because Black & Decker is a trusted brand. Sadly, I’m disappointed. Yes, it gets the wrinkles out but not without hassle. When using the steamer, it leaks EVERYWHERE. I spend more time drying the surrounding area than actually ironing my clothes. I thought that maybe I over filled it so I tried with little water and it still leaks. Very disappointed in Black & Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Enjoia

customer_reviews.title: Good, but steam / water logic is totally dumb
customer_reviews.text: There is no steam regulation, it always on. Water opening is not only inconvenient to pour, but even worse - it assumes horizontal position for pouring water. And if you happen to add water during usage - given no regulation you get non-stoppable steaming during pouring.
customer_reviews.author: Gusakov Andrey

customer_reviews.title: DON'T DO IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this iron!!! It really leaks everywhere...your clothes end up soaked and your hand is covered in water too. Definitely annoying and really not safe or practical. The absolute biggest waste of money ever!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eirelandogrl

customer_reviews.title: Better than an R-brand at a third of the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am incredibly pleased with this iron, and I really wanted to hate it. This B&D iron easily got out the deeply set wrinkles in my linen duvet and shams that the more expensive R-brand iron left behind. I've had a few underwhelming products from B&D in recent years, and I didn't really believe the Good Housekeeping rating which ranked THIS as tied for the best iron out there. Having recently returned a $70ish R-brand which I just "knew" I would adore, I figured with free returns I had nothing to lose. Get this one! You won't be disappointed! And the cord return is a great safety feature for those of us with little kids or are prone to clumsiness.
customer_reviews.author: RNsRuntheShow

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't get wrinkles out.
customer_reviews.text: The point of an iron is remove wrinkles. This iron just isn't that great at it. I bought it to replace an old B&D workhorse that I had for probably 20 years before it broke. Sadly, this one doesn't compare at all. It *is* fairly lightweight, but I wish it were a little heavier - I think it would work better. It goes through water like crazy. Pressed two 2-yard pieces of fabric after pre-washing and had to refill the tank. I am looking for a replacement now - this one will go to Salvation Army.
customer_reviews.author: K. Garretson

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good iron but they don't give you a filler cup
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good iron but they don't give you a filler cup. The retractable cord works 80% of the time. At other times, it gets tangled over itself on the inner reel, inside the iron. Difficult to see the water level in thew green plastic reservoir. Amazing, a company like Black and Decker not thinking it through and doing extensive consumer testing. It is a decent iron for 1200 watts.
customer_reviews.author: Yes

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this product as I iron almost every day
customer_reviews.text: Similar to other reviews, I've had this iron for abut 6 months, and it has become unusable. The plastic spray button has gotten increasingly frustrating to use, and now it does not work at all. The button stays stuck all the way down and will not allow for spray. Very disappointed with this product as I iron almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kelly

customer_reviews.title: New Iron
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews of this steam iron I thought it would be light weight. Upon receiving it I thought it was too heavy. I just checked the weight on the manufacturer's sheet & found that it was 2 lbs. Which might be great for others, but I have tendonitis in my wrist which makes it hard for me to use a heavy iron. I returned it & Amazon sent me a refund very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: octavia K.

customer_reviews.title: I like the iron but
customer_reviews.text: I like the iron but... I was recently on a cruise and there was a Vitessa in the room. I was amazed at how wonderful and easy it was to use. I got home and immediately ordered it. I think it's better than the one I had but it's not as great as the one from the cruise. They look similar but I guess the one I used on the cruise was an older model.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: face plate turns brown when you use starch
customer_reviews.text: it is very difficult to remove brown stuff that accumulates on faceplate of iron when i use starch. it gets onto clothes and does not come off. you must scrub vigorously with a soft cloth and simplegreen to remove brown stuff and when you are in the middle of ironing, you must wait for it to cool off. i have had other irons and this did not happen. not very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L.L

customer_reviews.title: A quality iron for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This iron is LIGHT WEIGHT and feels good in my hand. My first impression....so far a great steam iron. Time will tell how long the iron lasts. I need a full featured lightweight steam iron after shoulder surgery. Several travel irons I have purchased and used turned out to be junk.
customer_reviews.author: James Z

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A "NO"
customer_reviews.text: I have had many many steamed irons in my life. Since I am a professional seamster, I use lots of them. This is the worst iron that I have ever bought. Unfortunately I you can not evaluate it until you use it many times. It is so "weak" steam is not powerful. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Armeene B.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice plate finish, great cord reel, good steam
customer_reviews.text: The finish on the ironing surface is very high quality -- I've had cheap ones before where the finish came off on your clothes after a while. The reel (I will never buy an iron without one) works well, the reservoir is easy to fill and doesn't leak so far, and the steam is very good.
customer_reviews.author: lhq

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have used B & D irons for years and was excited to receive this new one when my old one died. Plugged it in - it worked and I put away for a week. Really used it today and water was running out of the burst of steam button onto my hand and the clothes I was ironing and I hadn't even used burst of steam. I threw away the box after testing it a week ago but now wish I had saved it so I could return it. Poor design!
customer_reviews.author: JTX

customer_reviews.title: Good quality iron.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is an excellent stream iron and even though my last one only lasted 2 years ( same model). I am sure its because they just aren't making appliances that last like they used to. But I knew it and didn't want to hunt for another brand. Glad they still carried it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nice but condensation noticed
customer_reviews.text: I've only ironed about five shirts and it did well. It was easy to use, glided nicely. One thing I didn't like is when I took it out of the box, there was condensation inside the water holding area, which made we wonder if it was used or it was tested by the company that made it ?? It shipped quickly and time will tell if it holds up well, I iron quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this iron. It heats up quickly. The water container is easy to fill. The cord is nice and long and the iron glides over the clothes to evenly press out the worst of wrinkles.
customer_reviews.author: Libbydlm

customer_reviews.title: Basic, cheap and does the basic job
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It’s good enough for the price and does the basic job. Retractable cord is hard to fully retract- it doesn’t reel in easily and all the way most of the times but still better than full hanging cord. Temperature control dial is outdated and you don’t really know when you actually changed temperature to next level. It’s ok if you use it for basic ironing but wouldn’t recommend for people who use iron a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Iron
customer_reviews.text: I had an iron for years that didn't really work right. This one is amazing. It steams, heats up quickly and has a see-through water casing. My only dislike is the cord is not as long as I hoped for. But it's nice that it is retractable.
customer_reviews.author: MomnCrew6

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker Iron
customer_reviews.text: This iron lasted less than 1 year. It leaks onto whatever you are ironing and the cord reel sticks so I had to work on it for a long time to try to get the cord out.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Old iron died; needed to purchase a new one and didn't want to spend a ton of money. This one is great and is very smooth. Love the retractable cord. Have not had any issues with it leaking water. My old iron was a Black & Decker and I had it for about 35 years. Never had a problem with it, so I chose Black & Decker again..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Our 20 year old iron began leaking rust on our clothes, so it was time to get a new one. This iron works well, and we like the controls that are simple to set without a lot of unnecessary features we don't need in an iron.
customer_reviews.author: Donnaster

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived with water droplets inside
customer_reviews.text: Everything is fine with the iron it’s just that the water tank came already wet with water residue inside... hence the 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Shaz

customer_reviews.title: It’s a pleasure to iron again!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had a new iron in many many years and when I finally purchased this one I realized how easy the job could be with the proper tool! This iron heats up in seconds! Does the job so quickly. It’s a pleasure to iron again! The only reason why I didn’t give it five stars is sometimes the retractable cord doesn’t cooperate. But I do love it and I would buy it again !
customer_reviews.author: Maria-Elena

customer_reviews.title: Steam Iron
customer_reviews.text: Light weight iron, durable -well-made- many options. The retractable cord got stuck a week after purchasing and Took a great deal of force to pull it out. Would I recommend purchasing it - Yes -after that one episode it’s been working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more diva irons
customer_reviews.text: After owning 3 "diva" irons in 10 years, I decided to give a Black and Decker Vitessa a try. Soooo much better than the Rowentas and much more reliable. Steams evenly and quickly but doesn't gulp water from the reservoir. Easy to fill, temperature is consistent. When you aim the sprinkler at a wrinkle it actually goes there; you don't have to be a rocket scientist to determine where the water will go. I'm super impressed with this iron and wish I'd known about it much earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weird, but goof
customer_reviews.text: This is a weird little iron, but it does the trick. It has a bigger body but same size heat surface which may it harder to get into sleeves etc. I still recommend it as it heats up quickly and the steam features are great.
customer_reviews.author: Coonie

customer_reviews.title: Never Lasted 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought it August 2019 stopped working December 2019. Just went cold in the middle of ironing still as light on but ice cold. I am very disappointed I bought it for my mom because she said she wanted black & decker
customer_reviews.author: davi

customer_reviews.title: Great Steam
customer_reviews.text: The iron is great except the cord would not stop retracting until I pulled off the retract button which was jammed. I could have returned it, but it was no big deal!
customer_reviews.author: Martha M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: price is right
customer_reviews.text: besides the sputtering/leaking with steam setting, the iron does it job. I will be using a hand held mister if I need steam going forward. Price is great
customer_reviews.author: choo choo cha boogie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible iron!
customer_reviews.text: I hate this iron! It weighs a ton, it leaks water and emits a horrible odor. It is huge, awkward and the water level is very difficult to see. This thing has no redeeming qualities. I will lose money and return it.
customer_reviews.author: Mantra mom

customer_reviews.title: Good for everyday use, B&D Iron.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Average iron. Water reservoir fairly easy to fill. Controls are limited and not easily read with lifting iron up to eye level. Fairly good iron for the price. If you do a lot of alterations/seamstress/etc, probably not a good iron for you. For everyday use and fast wrinkle remover, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SLG

customer_reviews.title: Thought I bought a good one based on the reviews but sorry I spent ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Dec 2016. Use it about 2x/ month. In April, it just conked out. Didn't emit any heat. Thought I bought a good one based on the reviews but sorry I spent for a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Toka

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed at water level indicator
customer_reviews.text: I bought one with a red water level indicator. It's too dark and I can't see how much water is in it. Frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M. Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Quit Working
customer_reviews.text: Loved this iron for the 6 weeks it worked. Now it turns on, lights up but does not heat up. I have tried everything I can. Extremely disappointing as with COVID I am avoiding going into stores and will now have to order another, different, iron. I have never in my 50+ years had an iron stop working in 6 short weeks.......
customer_reviews.author: A. Tenenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, designed to deceive and sell
customer_reviews.text: The website displays the iron as having numerous steam holes when in fact they are only dimples in the metal (46 each). In addition, the holes on the tip, on the back middle, and two on each side on the back, (18 each) are all sealed off from inside with metal and are not functional. In total, there are only 24 out of seemingly 64 steam holes that actually emit steam. Water fill port is cheaply made and awkward to access. Looks nice, designed to deceive and sell.
customer_reviews.author: boarbrook

customer_reviews.title: worked for 1 week
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this iron because my other one was on the verge of quitting. I pulled it out to use 2 weeks ago and it lasted 1 week. The bad part is that it is no longer returnable because I stored it in the closet beyond the return date. I had to go out and purchase another iron from Walmart so it was money wasted. The iron also leaked water each time I ironed.
customer_reviews.author: Gequana Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Steam Feature is quite good.
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron; I love the steam feature. It works very well and the retractable cord makes it easy to store away.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Territorial

customer_reviews.title: Retractable cord failed.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the cord failing to recoil, I still like the iron It heats up fast and works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: SANDRA GEISLER

customer_reviews.title: ... a different brand that we had for years and loved! I will not be buying this brand again
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an iron of a different brand that we had for years and loved! I will not be buying this brand again! It irons really well, but no matter what we do water leaks out all over the clothes we are ironing (yes we make sure that it is not overfilled and that the water cap is closed tightly) and when you push the steam button nothing happens. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Serena Rose

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great iron not an easy steamer. It's very heavy and though that might be fine for just an iron its head to use as an upright steamer.
customer_reviews.author: jonathanwromine

customer_reviews.title: Iron stopped working
customer_reviews.text: After about 3 weeks and barely any use. The iron stopped working. Do not purchase. Customer service is horrible even with manufacturers warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Umana-Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Not even boxed
customer_reviews.text: The iron was not boxed so by the time I got it the packaging was a mess. Luckily the iron worked
customer_reviews.author: Regina Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Used Item
customer_reviews.text: This iron did not appear to be new. It looks like a returned item that was tested and later presented as a new item for sale. The cord also does not retract properly. Not worth the hassle of returning.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working 5 months after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Flat out stopped heating up after working very well for 5 months. I've tried 5 different plugs around the house and still can't get it to a temperature too hot to touch. Hope I got 30 bucks worth of ironing out of it at least.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Great iron!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I have nothing bad to say about this iron. It does the job!
customer_reviews.author: D. WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron to replace my old one I had for 10 years. I bought it two months ago and it has stopped working. It doesn't heat up properly anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Costumer11192

customer_reviews.title: Used?
customer_reviews.text: Looks like mine was used before, but anyway work's well. And the wire doesn't going in all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Gevorg

customer_reviews.title: Great iron at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This iron performs with the best of them! I wanted one with a retractable cord, but I am only giving 4 stars due to the retracting mechanism is a little "fragile". It just doesn't feel like it is going to last for the life of the iron. But at this price, we should get our money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Keller

customer_reviews.title: Used product
customer_reviews.text: This came with no outter box and it was filled with water it was someone’s return
customer_reviews.author: A . C. DELLARAGIONE

customer_reviews.title: Retractable cord
customer_reviews.text: Like the narrow tip and steam hole pattern a lot, love the retractableb cord
customer_reviews.author: Marion L. Perrott

customer_reviews.title: Very leaky and weak temperature - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This iron is of very poor quality, just used for the first time on my dress shirts (on cotton mode with steam) and my shirts are covered with water spots and my iron table is also drenched with water leaks. Not sure if I'm going to return it or just throw it away and order a higher-end model.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Buyer

customer_reviews.title: happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. Makes ironing very easy. I like it a lot. Besides I needed a new iron .
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Cord Does Not Fully Retract!
customer_reviews.text: Cord will not fully retract. Purchased for this feature. Returning!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Takes too long to heat-up; cannot see water level through the dark red reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It’s amazing. Works very well. I iron a lot and this is the best iron I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.author: Software Engineer

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and light weight which is cool but it leaks like crazy. Pain in the you know what.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this model
customer_reviews.text: Happy with my purchase and love that the cord retracts
customer_reviews.author: Debimad

customer_reviews.title: Love the retractable cord!
customer_reviews.text: "I don't iron much, needed something inexpensive for occasional use, works fine and love the retractable cord!
customer_reviews.author: Lori H

customer_reviews.title: Very good iron
customer_reviews.text: This Black & Decker iron works great. It's light weight and press you clothing very good.
customer_reviews.author: Classy

customer_reviews.title: I especially like the retractable cord!
customer_reviews.text: Fair priced, light weight, and the retractable cord is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Pthree

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a year.
customer_reviews.text: This iron stopped working after less than a year. It worked well when it worked. I had to purchase a new iron to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Debby66

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this exactly one time. Much better than my old iron. Wife uses it regularly and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Dad

customer_reviews.title: A real good price
customer_reviews.text: I like the weight of the Iron and also the way the cord retracts
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and works well--heats up quickly. Not as powerful because of the lower wattage but gets the job done. Would recommend this iron
customer_reviews.author: Joe G

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job ironing.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't quite figured out the setting for steam. But then, I haven't really used the iron enough to give it a fair rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Retractable cord stuck, not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I used it once and it’s broken, the retractable cord is stuck inside, I cannot pull it out to connect it. I am very upset it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS IRON
customer_reviews.text: It broke in warranty period (no longer heats) in under a year of very light use (still looks new). No one from Black+Decker will cover it even though it is fully covered by warranty. Absolutely terrible; I highly recommend you do NOT buy this product or any other from Black+Decker
customer_reviews.author: Not a fan of black+decker

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The box came all kinds of dented. And the iron looks like someone had been using it for a year and then they just boxed it up and sent it to me. Severely disappointed, why am I paying full price for a used object? Steer away, the last Black & Decker iron I got also was used.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne Q.

customer_reviews.title: Makes ironing easy !
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done and makes it easy. Really puts out the steam.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Hard to add water
customer_reviews.text: I like the iron a lot so far, but it is super hard and annoying to put the water in it the way it is designed. Other than that, it does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have so far is that the cord doe not retract completely.
customer_reviews.author: Elynor

customer_reviews.title: Great iron
customer_reviews.text: I am one of those few people left that still uses an iron. I even iron pillow cases. My only suggestion would be an automatic turn off after 5-10 mins of non use.
customer_reviews.author: jill t delin

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this iron. It's on the heavy side but works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Nice iron
customer_reviews.text: We use these in our laundromat. Glides across clothes very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Hate it
customer_reviews.text: Retractable cord is stuck in only had the iron 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this iron over a year ago and it's still working strong. Definitely worth the price. You can't go wrong for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Reg

customer_reviews.title: love it, love that cord
customer_reviews.text: love it , love that cord , hope it last.
customer_reviews.author: gabi

customer_reviews.title: Too noisy
customer_reviews.text: I hate the beeping sound it makes every times it reaches the correct temperature, which is a lot. There is no way to shut this feature off and it terrifies my dog.
customer_reviews.author: John D. White

customer_reviews.title: Great iron for the money
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I got it because my iron was too heavy for me due to carpal tunnel pain. It's lightweight and gives great steam.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rozsitch

customer_reviews.title: love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I really love my iron so far..but will update if anything changes
customer_reviews.author: Andre K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my daughter loves this iron. and the fact that it's red is part of that. thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent steam and does a very good job overall
customer_reviews.text: Excellent steam and does a very good job overall. Knocked off 1 star as the cord reel is finicky and does not always retract fully without multiple tries.
customer_reviews.author: FairReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Love It !
customer_reviews.text: When my old, expensive iron fell apart , I realized it was time to replace it. I am glad i did. This iron is affordable and works well. This purchase was long overdue. What a difference !
customer_reviews.author: nancy tully

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: All was great, except retractable cord seems to jam up and you have to try and redo it often.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Reisdorf

customer_reviews.title: It Leaks :(
customer_reviews.text: It works like an iron but it LEAKS a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Flat Iron
customer_reviews.text: This steam iron works well. I like the point, its great for specialty ironing like quilting. It's even pretty!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: the product just stopped working now I have to buy a new one this just sucks!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: eleanor walker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice Iron box, real strong, easy to operate, gives a good iron, with different modes.
customer_reviews.author: Shashank H

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy !
customer_reviews.text: Very good buy ! I am using this for some time now. The steam options works great. The ergonomics and weight distribution is good. For the price it's a great buy !
customer_reviews.author: Fahim Huda

customer_reviews.title: BLACK+DECKER ICR2020 Vitessa Advanced Steam Iron -Great
customer_reviews.text: My wife is very pleased with her new BLACK+DECKER ICR2020 Vitessa Advanced Steam Iron.
customer_reviews.author: John Tipler Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle and works great
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted for an upgraded iron. Easy to handle and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Nichol Cassoni

customer_reviews.title: Cord did not retract completely
customer_reviews.text: Cord did not retract and that was an important feature for me. Everything else seemed to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Black & decker iron
customer_reviews.text: I love this black & decker iron works perfectly fine the retractable cable is perfect no tangle around fast shipping thanks
customer_reviews.author: jose guzman

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: It was great at first. I used this iron a few times but unfortunately it stopped working after about 3 weeks of use. The return window had closed and now I am stuck with this. And there's no way to contact seller. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tejinder Dhaliwal

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend this for y'all
customer_reviews.text: It's just perfect! Heats quickly! Irons smooths and nicely! Steam is nice and smooth. No dripping! Just as long as your smart enough to know not to ever over add the water in the iron! In the end you get perfect results. I loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Lameesyasin123

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This iron leaks terribly, I really wanted to like it because of the shape and weight.
customer_reviews.author: vancelit

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS IRON
customer_reviews.text: Bought it 2 months ago and used it hand full of time. But not today!!!! Will not heat up. Amazon will not allow to send back and getting someone to act on warranty "good luck"
customer_reviews.author: frances ruelas

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Vitessa Advanced Steam Iron with Retractable Cord, Nonstick Soleplate, Sage, ICR2020
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Nonstick Soleplate with Retractable Cord

The BLACK+DECKER Vitessa Advanced Steam Iron with Retractable Cord is streamlining garment care. The TrueGlide nonstick soleplate is engineered with Even Steam technology, which produces more consistent steam flow from heel to tip* for fast, professional results. Our proprietary SmartSteam Technology automatically optimizes steam levels based on the fabric setting you choose using the single control dial. The convenient retractable cord unwinds quickly and retracts with the touch of a button for easy use and storage. Plus, Vitessa delivers powerful bursts of steam to aggressively take out wrinkles, and can even be used vertically to quickly touch-up clothes right on the hanger. This premium performance is exactly what you’d expect from BLACK+DECKER, the number one brand in garment care**. 

*vs BLACK+DECKER IR08x standard iron with standard soleplate
**Source: NPD POS, data as of November 2016.
***When compared to the BLACK+DECKER model F920 iron coating CFT-862B.

BRAND STORY
By Black & Decker
feature_bullets: Even Steam Soleplate Design - The advanced soleplate design* is engineered to produce consistent steam flow from heel to tip for fast, professional results*vs BLACK+DECKER IR08x standard iron with standard soleplate
TrueGlide Nonstick Soleplate - The enhanced nonstick soleplate is engineered to glide smoothly across all types of fabrics
SmartSteam Technology - Take the guesswork out of ironing. SmartSteam automatically optimizes the amount of steam based on the temperature you select
Vertical Steaming - Use the iron as a steamer for quick touch-ups right on the hanger or for steaming curtains and drapes
Automatic Shutoff - For added peace of mind, the iron shuts off when left unattended for 30 seconds on its side or soleplate, and after 8 minutes on the heel rest
